name: id
desc: Component ID, not specified by default. If specified, it can be used to refer the component in option or API.

name: elements
elements.group
desc: `group` is the only type that can contain children, so that a group of elements can be positioned and transformed together.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Must be specified when define a graphic element at the first time.

Optional values:



[image](~graphic.elements-image),
[text](~graphic.elements-text),
[circle](~graphic.elements-circle),
[sector](~graphic.elements-sector),
[ring](~graphic.elements-ring),
[polygon](~graphic.elements-polygon),
[polyline](~graphic.elements-polyline),
[rect](~graphic.elements-rect),
[line](~graphic.elements-line),
[bezierCurve](~graphic.elements-bezierCurve),
[arc](~graphic.elements-arc),
[group](~graphic.elements-group),

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.


### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: x
children.desc: x position of element. In pixels.

children.name: y
children.desc: y position of element. In pixels.

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Degree value of rotation.

children.name: scaleX
children.desc: Scale on x.

children.name: scaleY
children.desc: Scale on y.

children.name: originX
children.desc: x value of element scale and rotation origin. In pixels

children.name: originY
children.desc: y value of element scale and rotation origin. In pixels.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-group.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-group.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-group.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-group.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-group.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.name: right
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-group.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-group.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-group.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-group.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-group.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.name: top
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](~graphic.elements-group.top) and [bottom](~graphic.elements-group.bottom) can work.

If [top](~graphic.elements-group.top) or [bottom](~graphic.elements-group.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-group.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

Optional values:

+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](~graphic.elements-group.top) and [bottom](~graphic.elements-group.bottom) can work.

If [top](~graphic.elements-group.top) or [bottom](~graphic.elements-group.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-group.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
children.desc:
Determine which canvas layer this element should be in.

Notice: Multiple canvas layer may affect performance.

children.name: info
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: textContent
children.desc:
Text block attached to an element and layout based on the element by `textConfig`.


The props the the same as [text](option.html#graphic.elements-text).

children.name: position
children.desc:
Position of `textContent`.

+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'top'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideBottomRight'
+ or like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Rotation of `textContent`. In radian.

children.name: layoutRect
children.desc:
Rect that `textContent` will be positioned.
Default to be the bounding box of host element.

```js
{
x: number
y: number
width: number
height: number
}
```

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Offset of the `textContent`.

The difference of `offset` and `position` is that `offset` will be applied in the rotation.

#### origin

`origin` is relative to the bounding box of the host element.
Can be percent value. Relative to the bounding box.
If `'center'` specified, it will be center of the bounding box.

Only available when position and rotation are both set.

+ like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`
+ 'center'

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the `layoutRect`。

children.name: local
children.desc: If `true`, it will apply host's transform.

children.name: insideFill
children.desc:
`insideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.insideFill` > "auto-calculated-fill"
In most cases, "auto-calculated-fill" is white.

children.name: insideStroke
children.desc:
`insideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.insideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be the same as `fill` of this element if possible, or null.

children.name: outsideFill
children.desc:
`outsideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is "inside", its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.outsideFill` > #000

children.name: outsideStroke
children.desc:
`outsideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is not "inside", its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.outsideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be a near white color to distinguish "front end" label with messy background (like other text label, line or other graphic).

children.name: inside
children.desc: Tell echarts that I can make sure this text is inside or not.

children.name: cursor
children.desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

children.name: draggable
children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive
children.desc: Whether use progressive render to improve performance. Usually used when number of element is too large.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Specify width of this `group`.

This width is only used for the positioning of its children.

When width is `0`, children can also be positioned according to its parent using `left: 'center'`.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Specify height of this `group`.

This height is only used for the positioning of its children.

When height is `0`, children can also be positioned according to its parent using `top: 'middle'`.

children.name: diffChildrenByName
children.desc:
In [custom series](~series-custom), when `diffChildrenByName` is set as `true`, for each [group](~graphic.elements-group) returned from [renderItem](~series-custom.renderItem), "diff" will be performed to its [children](~graphic.elements-group.children) according to the [name](~graphic.elements-polygon.name) attribute of each graphic elements. Here "diff" means that map the coming graphic elements to the existing graphic elements when repainting according to `name`, which enables the transition animation if data is modified.

But notice that the operation is performance consuming, do not use it for large data amount.

children.name: children
children.desc: A list of children, each item is a declaration of an element.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Must be specified when define a graphic element at the first time.

[line](~graphic.elements-line),
[bezierCurve](~graphic.elements-bezierCurve),
[arc](~graphic.elements-arc),
[group](~graphic.elements-group),

+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideBottomRight'

+ or like `['50%', '50%']`

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Rotation of `textContent`. In radian.

children.name: layoutRect
children.desc:
Rect that `textContent` will be positioned.
Default to be the bounding box of host element.

```js
{
x: number
y: number
width: number
height: number
}
```

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Offset of the `textContent`.

The difference of `offset` and `position` is that `offset` will be applied in the rotation.

#### origin

`origin` is relative to the bounding box of the host element.
Can be percent value. Relative to the bounding box.
If `'center'` specified, it will be center of the bounding box.

Only available when position and rotation are both set.

+ like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`
+ 'center'

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the `layoutRect`。

children.name: local
children.desc: If `true`, it will apply host's transform.

children.name: insideFill
children.desc:
`insideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.insideFill` > "auto-calculated-fill"
In most cases, "auto-calculated-fill" is white.

children.name: insideStroke
children.desc:
`insideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.insideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be the same as `fill` of this element if possible, or null.

children.name: outsideFill
children.desc:
`outsideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is "inside", its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.outsideFill` > #000

children.name: outsideStroke
children.desc:
`outsideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is not "inside", its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.outsideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be a near white color to distinguish "front end" label with messy background (like other text label, line or other graphic).

### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-text.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-text.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-text.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-text.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-text.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.outsideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be a near white color to distinguish "front end" label with messy background (like other text label, line or other graphic).

children.name: inside
children.desc: Tell echarts that I can make sure this text is inside or not.

children.name: cursor
children.desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

children.name: draggable
children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive
children.desc: Whether use progressive render to improve performance. Usually used when number of element is too large.

children.name: x
children.desc: The x value of the left-top corner of the element in the coordinate system of its parent.

children.name: y
children.desc: The y value of the left-top corner of the element in the coordinate system of its parent.

children.name: width
children.desc: The width of the shape of the element.

children.name: height
children.desc: The height of the shape of the element.

children.name: r
children.desc:
Specify border radius of the rectangular here. Generally, `r` should be `[topLeftRadius, topRightRadius, BottomRightRadius, bottomLeftRadius]`, where each item is a number.

Abbreviation is enabled, for example:
+ `r`: `1`         means `[1, 1, 1, 1]`
+ `r`: `[1]`       means `[1, 1, 1, 1]`
+ `r`: `[1, 2]`    means `[1, 2, 1, 2]`
+ `r`: `[1, 2, 3]` means `[1, 2, 3, 2]`

children.name: style
children.desc:
More attributes in `style` (for example, [rich text](tutorial.html#Rich%20Text)), see the `style` related attributes in [zrender/graphic/Displayable](https://ecomfe.github.io/zrender-doc/public/api.html#zrenderdisplayable).

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](~series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

children.name: lineWidth
children.desc: Width of stroke.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Width of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: X offset of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Y offset of shadow.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: color of shadow.

children.name: focus
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



When it's highlighted, whether to fade out of other data to focus the highlighted. The following configurations are supported:

+ `'none'` Do not fade out other data, it's by default.
+ `'self'` Only focus (not fade out) the element of the currently highlighted data.
+ `'series'` Focus on all elements of the series which the currently highlighted data belongs to.

children.name: blurScope
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



The range of fade out when `focus` is enabled. Support the following configurations

+ `'coordinateSystem'`
+ `'series'`
+ `'global'`

id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.


### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.desc: Degree value of rotation.

children.name: scaleX
children.desc: Scale on x.

children.name: scaleY
children.desc: Scale on y.

children.name: originX
children.desc: x value of element scale and rotation origin. In pixels

children.name: originY
children.desc: y value of element scale and rotation origin. In pixels.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-circle.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-circle.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-circle.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-circle.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-circle.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.name: right

children.desc:

+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](~graphic.elements-circle.top) and [bottom](~graphic.elements-circle.bottom) can work.

If [top](~graphic.elements-circle.top) or [bottom](~graphic.elements-circle.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-circle.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
children.desc:
Determine which canvas layer this element should be in.

Notice: Multiple canvas layer may affect performance.

children.name: info
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: textContent
children.desc:
Text block attached to an element and layout based on the element by `textConfig`.


The props the the same as [text](option.html#graphic.elements-text).

children.name: position
children.desc:
Position of `textContent`.

+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'top'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideBottomRight'
+ or like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Rotation of `textContent`. In radian.

children.name: layoutRect
children.desc:
Rect that `textContent` will be positioned.
Default to be the bounding box of host element.

```js
{
x: number
y: number
width: number
height: number
}
```

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Offset of the `textContent`.

The difference of `offset` and `position` is that `offset` will be applied in the rotation.

#### origin

`origin` is relative to the bounding box of the host element.
Can be percent value. Relative to the bounding box.
If `'center'` specified, it will be center of the bounding box.

Only available when position and rotation are both set.

+ like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`
+ 'center'

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the `layoutRect`。

children.name: local
children.desc: If `true`, it will apply host's transform.

children.name: insideFill
children.desc:
`insideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.insideFill` > "auto-calculated-fill"
In most cases, "auto-calculated-fill" is white.

children.name: insideStroke
children.desc:

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:

+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)

+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be the same as `fill` of this element if possible, or null.

When it's highlighted, whether to fade out of other data to focus the highlighted. The following configurations are supported:

+ `'none'` Do not fade out other data, it's by default.
+ `'self'` Only focus (not fade out) the element of the currently highlighted data.
+ `'series'` Focus on all elements of the series which the currently highlighted data belongs to.

> Since `v5.0.0`



The range of fade out when `focus` is enabled. Support the following configurations

+ `'coordinateSystem'`
+ `'series'`
+ `'global'`

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.


### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: x
children.desc: x position of element. In pixels.

children.name: y
children.desc: y position of element. In pixels.

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Degree value of rotation.

children.name: scaleX
children.desc: Scale on x.

children.name: scaleY
children.desc: Scale on y.

children.name: originX
children.desc: x value of element scale and rotation origin. In pixels

children.name: originY
children.desc: y value of element scale and rotation origin. In pixels.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-sector.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-sector.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-sector.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-sector.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-sector.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.name: right
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-sector.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-sector.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-sector.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-sector.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-sector.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.name: top
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](~graphic.elements-sector.top) and [bottom](~graphic.elements-sector.bottom) can work.

If [top](~graphic.elements-sector.top) or [bottom](~graphic.elements-sector.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-sector.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
children.desc:
Determine which canvas layer this element should be in.

Notice: Multiple canvas layer may affect performance.

children.name: info
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: textContent
children.desc:
Text block attached to an element and layout based on the element by `textConfig`.


The props the the same as [text](option.html#graphic.elements-text).

children.name: position
children.desc:
Position of `textContent`.

+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'top'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideBottomRight'
+ or like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Rotation of `textContent`. In radian.

children.name: layoutRect
children.desc:
Rect that `textContent` will be positioned.
Default to be the bounding box of host element.

```js
{
x: number
y: number
width: number
height: number
}
```

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Offset of the `textContent`.

The difference of `offset` and `position` is that `offset` will be applied in the rotation.

#### origin

`origin` is relative to the bounding box of the host element.
Can be percent value. Relative to the bounding box.
If `'center'` specified, it will be center of the bounding box.

Only available when position and rotation are both set.

+ like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`
+ 'center'

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the `layoutRect`。

children.name: local
children.desc: If `true`, it will apply host's transform.

children.name: insideFill
children.desc:
`insideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.insideFill` > "auto-calculated-fill"
In most cases, "auto-calculated-fill" is white.

children.name: insideStroke
children.desc:
`insideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.insideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be the same as `fill` of this element if possible, or null.

children.name: outsideFill
children.desc:
`outsideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is "inside", its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.outsideFill` > #000

children.name: outsideStroke
children.desc:
`outsideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is not "inside", its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.outsideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be a near white color to distinguish "front end" label with messy background (like other text label, line or other graphic).

children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive

children.name: cx

children.name: cy
children.desc: The y value of the center of the element in the coordinate system of its parent.

children.name: r
children.desc: Outside radius.

children.name: r0
children.desc: Inside radius.

children.name: endAngle
children.desc: end angle, in radian.

children.name: clockwise

children.name: style
children.desc:
More attributes in `style` (for example, [rich text](tutorial.html#Rich%20Text)), see the `style` related attributes in [zrender/graphic/Displayable](https://ecomfe.github.io/zrender-doc/public/api.html#zrenderdisplayable).

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](~series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

If [left](~graphic.elements-polygon.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-polygon.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-polygon.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.name: right
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-polygon.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-polygon.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-polygon.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-polygon.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-polygon.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.

children.name: top
children.desc:

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](~graphic.elements-polygon.top) and [bottom](~graphic.elements-polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](~graphic.elements-polygon.top) or [bottom](~graphic.elements-polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](~graphic.elements-polygon.top) and [bottom](~graphic.elements-polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](~graphic.elements-polygon.top) or [bottom](~graphic.elements-polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
children.desc:
Determine which canvas layer this element should be in.

Notice: Multiple canvas layer may affect performance.

children.name: info
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: textContent
children.desc:
Text block attached to an element and layout based on the element by `textConfig`.


The props the the same as [text](option.html#graphic.elements-text).

children.name: position
children.desc:
Position of `textContent`.

+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'top'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideBottomRight'
+ or like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Rotation of `textContent`. In radian.

children.name: layoutRect
children.desc:
Rect that `textContent` will be positioned.
Default to be the bounding box of host element.

```js
{
x: number
y: number
width: number
height: number
}
```

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Offset of the `textContent`.

The difference of `offset` and `position` is that `offset` will be applied in the rotation.

#### origin

`origin` is relative to the bounding box of the host element.
Can be percent value. Relative to the bounding box.
If `'center'` specified, it will be center of the bounding box.

Only available when position and rotation are both set.

+ like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`
+ 'center'

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the `layoutRect`。

children.name: local
children.desc: If `true`, it will apply host's transform.

children.name: insideFill
children.desc:
`insideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.insideFill` > "auto-calculated-fill"
In most cases, "auto-calculated-fill" is white.

children.name: insideStroke
children.desc:
`insideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.insideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be the same as `fill` of this element if possible, or null.

children.name: outsideFill
children.desc:
`outsideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is "inside", its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.outsideFill` > #000

children.name: outsideStroke
children.desc:
`outsideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is not "inside", its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.outsideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be a near white color to distinguish "front end" label with messy background (like other text label, line or other graphic).

children.name: inside
children.desc: Tell echarts that I can make sure this text is inside or not.

children.name: cursor
children.desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

children.name: draggable
children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive
children.desc: Whether use progressive render to improve performance. Usually used when number of element is too large.

children.name: points
children.desc: A list of points, which defines the shape, like `[[22, 44], [44, 55], [11, 44], ...]`.

children.name: smooth
children.desc:
Whether smooth the line.

+ If the value is number, bezier interpolation is used, and the value specified the level of smooth, which is in the range of `[0, 1]`.
+ If the value is `'spline'`, Catmull-Rom spline interpolation is used.

children.name: smoothConstraint
children.desc:
Whether prevent the smooth process cause the line out of the bounding box.

Only works when `smooth` is `number` (bezier smooth).

children.name: style
children.desc:
More attributes in `style` (for example, [rich text](tutorial.html#Rich%20Text)), see the `style` related attributes in [zrender/graphic/Displayable](https://ecomfe.github.io/zrender-doc/public/api.html#zrenderdisplayable).

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](~series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](~series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

children.name: fill
children.desc: Color filled in this element.

children.name: stroke
children.desc: Color of stroke.

children.name: lineWidth
children.desc: Width of stroke.

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc: Width of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: X offset of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Y offset of shadow.

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: color of shadow.

children.name: focus
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



When it's highlighted, whether to fade out of other data to focus the highlighted. The following configurations are supported:

+ `'none'` Do not fade out other data, it's by default.
+ `'self'` Only focus (not fade out) the element of the currently highlighted data.
+ `'series'` Focus on all elements of the series which the currently highlighted data belongs to.

children.name: blurScope
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



The range of fade out when `focus` is enabled. Support the following configurations

+ `'coordinateSystem'`
+ `'series'`
+ `'global'`

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.


### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

If [top](~graphic.elements-line.top) or [bottom](~graphic.elements-line.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-line.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
children.desc:
Determine which canvas layer this element should be in.

Notice: Multiple canvas layer may affect performance.

children.name: info
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: textContent
children.desc:
Text block attached to an element and layout based on the element by `textConfig`.


The props the the same as [text](option.html#graphic.elements-text).

children.name: position
children.desc:
Position of `textContent`.

+ 'left'
+ 'right'
+ 'top'
+ 'bottom'
+ 'inside'
+ 'insideLeft'
+ 'insideRight'
+ 'insideTop'
+ 'insideBottom'
+ 'insideTopLeft'
+ 'insideTopRight'
+ 'insideBottomLeft'
+ 'insideBottomRight'
+ or like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`

children.name: rotation
children.desc: Rotation of `textContent`. In radian.

children.name: layoutRect
children.desc:
Rect that `textContent` will be positioned.
Default to be the bounding box of host element.

```js
{
x: number
y: number
width: number
height: number
}
```

children.name: offset
children.desc:
Offset of the `textContent`.

The difference of `offset` and `position` is that `offset` will be applied in the rotation.

#### origin

`origin` is relative to the bounding box of the host element.
Can be percent value. Relative to the bounding box.
If `'center'` specified, it will be center of the bounding box.

Only available when position and rotation are both set.

+ like `[12, 33]`
+ or like `['50%', '50%']`
+ 'center'

children.name: distance
children.desc: Distance to the `layoutRect`。

children.name: local
children.desc: If `true`, it will apply host's transform.

children.name: insideFill
children.desc:
`insideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.insideFill` > "auto-calculated-fill"
In most cases, "auto-calculated-fill" is white.

children.name: insideStroke
children.desc:
`insideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is `"inside"`, its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.insideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be the same as `fill` of this element if possible, or null.

children.name: outsideFill
children.desc:
`outsideFill` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is "inside", its final `fill` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.fill` > `textConfig.outsideFill` > #000

children.name: outsideStroke
children.desc:
`outsideStroke` is a color string or left empty.

If a `textContent` is not "inside", its final `stroke` will be picked by this priority:
`textContent.style.stroke` > `textConfig.outsideStroke` > "auto-calculated-stroke"

The rule of getting "auto-calculated-stroke":

+ If
+ (A) the `fill` is specified in style (either in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ or (B) needed to draw text background (either defined in `textContent.style` or `textContent.style.rich`)
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be null.
+ Otherwise
+ "auto-calculated-stroke" will be a near white color to distinguish "front end" label with messy background (like other text label, line or other graphic).

children.name: focus
children.desc:
> Since `v5.0.0`



When it's highlighted, whether to fade out of other data to focus the highlighted. The following configurations are supported:

+ `'none'` Do not fade out other data, it's by default.
+ `'self'` Only focus (not fade out) the element of the currently highlighted data.

Optional values:



[image](~graphic.elements-image),

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.


### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the height of its parent.
+ `'center'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [left](~graphic.elements-bezierCurve.left) and [right](~graphic.elements-bezierCurve.right) can work.

If [left](~graphic.elements-bezierCurve.left) or [right](~graphic.elements-bezierCurve.right) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](~graphic.elements-bezierCurve.shape) (like `x`, `cx`) will not work.
